arts.ttl: Watch best of action as Rangers beat Celtic in derby
arts.sum: Watch the best of the action as Rangers beat Celtic 3-0 in the second Scottish Premiership Old Firm derby of the season.

arts.ttl: Celtic’s Engels has near miss after being struck by coin above eye, says Rodgers
arts.sum: Rangers spokesperson says club condemn the incident Rodgers: ‘An inch lower, it would have been in the eye’ Celtic’s manager, Brendan Rodgers, believes Arne Engels was close to sustaining a serious eye injury after a coin thrown from the Ibrox stands towards the end of Rangers’ 3-0 Old Firm victory struck the Belgian midfielder on the head. The incident was the latest in a serious of unsavoury events in Scottish football this season. Engels fell to the turf as he prepared to take an 87th-minute corner. It was soon clear a missile had struck him above his left eye. The referee, Don Robertson, handed a coin to the fourth official after Engels had returned to his feet and declared himself able to play on. The coin was then given to a police officer, who placed it in an evidence bag. Rodgers confirmed the coin had hit Engels, Celtic’s record signing. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Ryan Kent 'returning' to Rangers rumour erupts in Turkey and club may already have answer from free agent
arts.sum: The rumour mill has ramped up over a potential return for the winger

arts.ttl: Celtic midfielder Engels hit by coin thrown from stands in 3-0 loss to Rangers at Ibrox
arts.sum: “We’re just lucky that it didn’t hit him right in the eye,” Celtic defender Alistair Johnston said. Engels fell to the ground after being hit near his left eye as he went to take a corner kick.

arts.ttl: Rodgers says lead maybe 'took Old Firm edge off' for Celtic
arts.sum: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers suggests being so far ahead at the top of the Scottish Premiership might have "subconsciously" affected his side in their Old Firm defeat.

arts.ttl: Everyone can see Rangers 'on right track' - Clement
arts.sum: Manager Philippe Clement says the manner of Rangers' win over Celtic shows they are making progress.

arts.ttl: 'Real Rangers stand up, but can they keep standing?'
arts.sum: Rangers showed hunger, workrate, creativity and ambition to blow Celtic away. But can they maintain those levels, asks Tom English?

arts.ttl: Celtic defender calls for respect after teammate hit by coin during Old Firm derby
arts.sum: Arne Engels was struck near the end of a 3-0 Rangers win at Ibrox

arts.ttl: Celtic given 'couldn't be bothered' assessment from former Rangers striker
arts.sum: Celtic didn't really lay a glove on Rangers.

arts.ttl: HIGHLIGHTS: Rangers dominate in stunning Old Firm win against Celtic
arts.sum: Watch highlights from the Scottish Premiership match between Rangers and Celtic.
